ProteomicsExplorer 0.99.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Displays a correlation matrix of the quantitative data of a numeric matrix.

Source: R/mod_intensity.R, R/plot_boxplot.R, R/plot_violin.R
intensity-plots.Rd

xxxx

mod_intensity_ui(id)

mod_intensity_server(id, se, conds, ...)

boxPlot(data, conds, subset = NULL, pal.name = NULL)

violinPlot(data, conds, subset = NULL, pal.name)

Arguments

id

xxx

se

xxx

conds

xxx

...

xxx

data

An instance of the class matrix

subset

A vector of index indicating rows to highlight

pal.name

xxx

Value

NA NA A boxplot A violinplot

Author

Samuel Wieczorek, Anais Courtier, Enora Fremy

Examples

library(QFeatures)
data(ft)
conds <- colData(ft)$Condition
violinPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds)
#> Error in violinPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds): could not find function "violinPlot"
violinPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds, subset = c(2,4))
#> Error in violinPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds, subset = c(2, 4)): could not find function "violinPlot"

boxPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds)
#> Error in boxPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds): could not find function "boxPlot"
boxPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds, subset = c(2,4))
#> Error in boxPlot(assay(ft, 1), conds, subset = c(2, 4)): could not find function "boxPlot"


#------------------------------------------
# Shiny module
#------------------------------------------
if(interactive()){
data(ft)
 ui <- mod_intensity_ui('iplot')

 server <- function(input, output, session) {
  mod_intensity_server('iplot', 
                       reactive({ft[[1]]}),
                       colData(ft)$Condition
                       )}
 
 shinyApp(ui=ui, server=server)
}
